intro: Dalea tuberculina, commonly known as the rough dalesia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are trifoliate, with small, hairy leaflets, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. Dalea tuberculina is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
